Get delay before new attempt at task such as connecting, using well known binary exponential backoff algorithm

Parameters:
failedAttempts - Current number of failed attempts
firstFailureDelay - Delay after first failure in chosen time unit
maxDelay - Maximum allowed delay in chosen time unit
Returns:

getExpiryMillisecondsFromNow

public static int getExpiryMillisecondsFromNow(long expiryTime)
Get an expiry time expressed as milliseconds in the future from now. When passing objects containing expiry time fields between nodes in a cluster, assuming message transmission to be of relatively short and constant time, and some degree of small inaccuracy to be preferable to the possibility of a large inaccuracy, passing expiry times as offsets into the future rather than absolute times can be preferable because if one system clock deviates from the norm, passed objects are still held of the same amount of time. Furthermore, systems like AMF/RTMP compress can compress smaller values, leading to more efficient network transmission of the values.

Parameters:
expiryTime - The expiry time described as the difference, measured in milliseconds, between that time and midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC
Returns:
The difference between the current time and the expiry time. 0 is returned if expiryTime is in the past
